column4: so your idea is to install everything on one machine using ubuntu's package manager and then mount the directory the software gets installed to on the other machines?
yes, that's exactly the point.  it saves a lot of wear and tear on Ubuntu mirrors.
k, is mounting /usr instead of /usr/local a dumb idea?  I don't know of a straightforward way to change where packages get installed to
mounting /usr is most likely not going to work for us.  It's a thought, though.
